title: Asymptotic Counting of Latin Rectangles
overview: Give an asymptotic formula for the number L(k,n) of k×n Latin rectangles. A k×n Latin rectangle has n symbols, each appearing once per row and at most once per column.
conclusion: PARTIALLY SOLVED: Erdős-Kaplansky (1946) proved L(k,n) ~ e^{-C(k,2)} · (n!)^k when k = o((log n)^{3/2-ε}). Yamamoto (1951) extended to k ≤ n^{1/3-o(1)}. The general asymptotic for k = Θ(n) or k = Θ(n^α) with α > 1/3 remains OPEN.
references: Erdős-Kaplansky (1946) - Asymptotic formula for small k
